title.en: English for the Students of Genetic Engineering, Level B2
title.et: Erialane inglise keel geenitehnoloogia üliõpilastele, tase B2

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en:
The topics covered during the course:
DNA structure
Genome sequencing
CRISPR/Cas9 genetic scissors (genome editing technology)
Mutations
Genetic diseases
Gene therapy
Viral vectors
Exosomes
DNA extraction
Polymerase chain reaction (PCR)
description.et:
Kursusel käsitletakse järgnevaid teemasid:
DNA struktuur
Genoomi sekveneerimine
CRISPR/Cas9 tehnoloogia
Mutatsioonid
Geneetilised haigused
Geeniteraapia
Viirusvektorid
Eksosoomid
DNA eraldamine
Polümeraasi ahelreaktsioon

objectives.en: The main aim of the course is to expand students' general academic and subject-specific vocabulary through a wide variety of activities:
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on arendada üldakadeemilist ja erialast sõnavara mitmesuguste tegevuste kaudu:
erialaste tekstide lugemine, kuulamine ja arutamine,

learning_outcomes.en: On completion of the course, the learners
have expanded their general academic and subject-specific vocabulary,
learning_outcomes.et: on laiendanud oma üldakadeemilist ja erialast sõnavara,

learning_outcomes.en: are able to better understand subject-specific texts,
are able to make academic presentations.

description.et: TEST 1
TEST 2
PRESENTATION
INDEPENDENT READING/INDIVIDUAL ANSWERING

grade_preconditions.et:
1 ACTIVE participation in the seminars and/or in the e-study. Active participation means doing homework regularly (weekly tasks).
2 Passing weekly self-assessment tests. Weekly self-assessment tests are open on Wednesdays from 18:00 to 18:20! 
BONUS! The students who attend all the seminars (being well-prepared and active) and pass weekly self-assessment tests at the first attempt with a high score (18-20 points), do not need to take mid-term tests.
3 Passing two mid-term tests with the minimum score of 70%. Both tests can be taken twice.
4 Making a presentation on a subject-specific topic.
5 Reading and summarizing a subject-specific research article.

grade_evaluation.et:
Arvestus saadakse siis, kui SEMESTRI JOOKSUL on täidetud KÕIK hindamisele pääsemise tingimused.
Non-differentiated assessment based on active participation in the seminars and/or in the e-study, passing weekly self-assessment tests, passing two mid-term tests, making a presentation on a subject-specific topic and reading/summarising a subject-specific research article.

debt_elimination.et:
Kokkuleppel õppejõuga.
By prior arrangement with the teacher.

description.et:
WEEK 1/2 - group B - September 6, group A - September 9
Introduction to the course. Course outline.
Test your knowledge quiz.

WEEK 2/3 - group B - September 13, group A - September 16
What is special about academic English?
The first Human Genome Project. Genome sequencing.
Genetic testing.

WEEK 3/4 - group B - September 20, group A - September 23
CRISPR-Cas9 genetic scissors.
Academic English - nouns.

WEEK 4/5 - e-study (September 27/September 30)
The 2023 Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine. mRNA vaccines.

MID-TERM TEST 1 - 9:00-9:45 (via Moodle)

Group B - October 4 
Group A - October 7

WEEK 6/7 - group B - October 11, group A - October 14
Instructions on how to structure a presentation and summarize a subject-specific research article.
Mutations. Classification of genetic disorders.
Academic English - key verbs.

WEEK 7/8 - group B - October 18, group A - October 21
Gene therapy. Gene delivery - viral and non-viral vectors. Exosomes.
Academic English - key adjectives.

WEEK 8/9 - group B - October 25, group A - October 28
DNA extraction.
Lab equipment.
Academic English - key adverbs.

WEEK 9/10 - e-study (November 1/November 4)
Polymerase chain reaction (PCR).
Kary B. Mullis - the inventor of PCR.

MID-TERM TEST 2 - 9:00 - 9:45 

Group B - November 8 (via Moodle)
Group A - November 11 via Moodle)

WEEK 11/12
Presentations 
Group B - November 18
Group A - November 21

WEEK 12/13
Presentations
Group B - November 25
Group A - November 28

WEEK 13/14
Individual answering (via Zoom)

WEEK 14/15
Individual answering (via Zoom)

WEEK 15/16
Individual answering (via Zoom)
Retaking tests
